issue.title: X3/X4 Not Responding to Velocity Commands in Local Cloudsim

content.raw:
I rebuilt everything and ran again. Same problem. Everything seems to be connected on the ROS side from what I can tell \(cmd\_vel → ros1\_ign\_bridge\_twist\). It does not appear that individual rotor commands are being piped anywhere though. I should still be on the tunnel\_circuit branch, correct?

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2912117380-overall.jpg)
‌

also:

```
arthur@arthur-XPS-15-9570:~/subt_hello_world/docker$ rostopic info /charlie/cmd_vel 
Type: geometry_msgs/Twist

Publishers: 
 * /charlie/ros1_ign_bridge_twist (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:33905/)
 * /charlie_vel (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:37199/)

Subscribers: 
 * /charlie/ros1_ign_bridge_twist (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:33905/)
 * /charlie/cmdvel_transform (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:45333/)


arthur@arthur-XPS-15-9570:~/subt_hello_world/docker$ rostopic info /charlie/command/motor_speed 
Type: mav_msgs/Actuators

Publishers: 
 * /charlie/roll_pitch_yawrate_thrust_controller_node (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:38949/)

Subscribers: None


arthur@arthur-XPS-15-9570:~/subt_hello_world/docker$ rostopic info /charlie/command/roll_pitch_yawrate_thrust 
Type: mav_msgs/RollPitchYawrateThrust

Publishers: 
 * /charlie/cmdvel_transform (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:45333/)

Subscribers: 
 * /charlie/roll_pitch_yawrate_thrust_controller_node (http://arthur-XPS-15-9570:38949/)


arthur@arthur-XPS-15-9570:~/subt_hello_world/docker$ 
```

If you can’t reproduce this I’ll just remove the entrypoint for the local cloudsim simulator and start it from an interactive shell so I can investigate on the Ignition side.

I rebuilt everything and ran again. Same problem. Everything seems to be connected on the ROS side from what I can tell (cmd_vel → ros1_ign_bridge_twist). It does not appear that individual rotor commands are being piped anywhere though. I should still be on the tunnel_circuit branch, correct?
